title: `torch.gesv` does not handle batches per the documentation.
body_html:
Issue description

torch.gesv does not handle batches per the documentation:

torch.gesv(B, A) can take in 2D inputs B, A or inputs that are batches of 2D matrices.

Minimal example

>>> import torch
>>> torch.__version__
'0.4.0'
>>> n = 100
>>> m = 6
>>> k = 3
>>> B = torch.Tensor(n, m, k)  # Docs: input matrix of size (*,m,k)
>>> A = torch.Tensor(n, m, m)  # Docs: input square matrix of size (*,m,m)
>>> A.shape; B.shape
torch.Size([100, 6, 6])
torch.Size([100, 6, 3])
>>> torch.gesv(B, A)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
RuntimeError: invalid argument 2: A should have 2 dimensions, but has 3 at 
/Users/soumith/minicondabuild3/conda-bld/pytorch_1524590658547/work/aten/src/TH/generic/THTensorLapack.c:110

System Info

PyTorch version: 0.4.0
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: None

OS: Mac OSX 10.13.4
GCC version: Could not collect
CMake version: version 3.6.2

Python version: 3.6
Is CUDA available: No
CUDA runtime version: No CUDA
GPU models and configuration: No CUDA
Nvidia driver version: No CUDA
cuDNN version: No CUDA

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip3] numpy (1.13.3)
[pip3] numpydoc (0.7.0)
[conda] pytorch                   0.4.0           py36_cuda0.0_cudnn0.0_1    pytorch
[conda] torchvision               0.2.1           py36_1    pytorch

body:
## Issue description

`torch.gesv` does not handle batches per the [documentation](https://pytorch.org/docs/master/torch.html#torch.gesv):

> `torch.gesv(B, A)` can take in 2D inputs B, A or inputs that are batches of 2D matrices.

## Minimal example

```
>>> import torch
>>> torch.__version__
'0.4.0'
>>> n = 100
>>> m = 6
>>> k = 3
>>> B = torch.Tensor(n, m, k)  # Docs: input matrix of size (*,m,k)
>>> A = torch.Tensor(n, m, m)  # Docs: input square matrix of size (*,m,m)
>>> A.shape; B.shape
torch.Size([100, 6, 6])
torch.Size([100, 6, 3])
>>> torch.gesv(B, A)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
RuntimeError: invalid argument 2: A should have 2 dimensions, but has 3 at 
/Users/soumith/minicondabuild3/conda-bld/pytorch_1524590658547/work/aten/src/TH/generic/THTensorLapack.c:110
```

## System Info

```
PyTorch version: 0.4.0
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: None

OS: Mac OSX 10.13.4
GCC version: Could not collect
CMake version: version 3.6.2

Python version: 3.6
Is CUDA available: No
CUDA runtime version: No CUDA
GPU models and configuration: No CUDA
Nvidia driver version: No CUDA
cuDNN version: No CUDA

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip3] numpy (1.13.3)
[pip3] numpydoc (0.7.0)
[conda] pytorch                   0.4.0           py36_cuda0.0_cudnn0.0_1    pytorch
[conda] torchvision               0.2.1           py36_1    pytorch
